DataElement.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Viral Load Assay Performed Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information relating to a human immunodeficiency virus viral load (the number of HIV viral particles in a sample of blood plasma) assay performed._The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Viral Load Assay Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a human immunodeficiency virus viral load (the number of HIV viral particles in a sample of blood plasma) assay performed.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Human Immunodeficiency Virus Viral Load Assay
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Human immunodeficiency virus. Species of LENTIVIRUS, subgenus primate lentiviruses (LENTIVIRUSES, PRIMATE), formerly designated T-cell lymphotropic virus type III/lymphadenopathy-associated virus (HTLV-III/LAV). It is acknowledged to be the agent responsible for the acute infectious manifestations, neurologic disorders, and immunologic abnormalities linked to the ACQUIRED IMMUNODEFICIENCY SYNDROME.:The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.:A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)

Concepts.definition: The virus isolated and recognized as the etiologic agent of AIDS. HIV-1 is classified as a lentivirus, a subtype of retroviruses.
The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.
A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have an unde
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based tests

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do they have a detectable viral load on quantitative PCR?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Within 4 weeks prior to randomization, did the patient have undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based test?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an undetectable HIV viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Tex_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an undetectable HIV viral load within 6 months of Step 1 registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has known HIV infection, does patient have negative serology and an undetectable viral load?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient known to be HIV positive on effective anti-retroviral therapy have an undetectable HIV viral load within 6 months of enrollment?
